newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Bomb blasts latest Middle East bloodshed.
newsitem.headline: Bomb blasts latest Middle East bloodshed.

text.p: The bombs that ripped through an open market in Jewish west Jerusalem on Wednesday were the latest in a string of attacks since Israel and the PLO signed an interim peace deal in 1993.
Here are some of the others:
Feb 25, 1994 - Jewish settler kills 29 Palestinians praying at a Hebron mosque, stalling peace talks for five weeks as negotiators argue over Palestinian security in the West Bank city.
April 6, 1994 - Bus blast in northern Israeli town of Afula kills eight Israelis and a suicide bomber. The Palestinian Moslem militant movement Hamas claims responsibility.
April 13, 1994 - Bus blast in crowded bus station in Israeli town of Hadera kills five and a Hamas suicide bomber.
Oct 19, 1994 - Hamas bomber kills himself and 22 other people in suicide bombing on Israeli bus on Tel Aviv's main Dizengoff street.

Nov 11, 1994 - Palestinian suicide bomber on a bicycle kills three Israelis and himself near Netzarim settlement in central Gaza. Islamic Jihad, which like Hamas opposed the 1993 Israeli-PLO peace deal, claims responsibility.
Jan 22, 1995 - Two Islamic Jihad suicide bombers kill 21 Israelis, all but one of them soldiers, in explosions at Beit Lid bus stop in central Israel.

April 2, 1995 - Mysterious explosion in Gaza City apartment kills several Palestinians, among them top Hamas guerrilla Kamal Kheil and one of his assistants. Hamas, vowing revenge, blames Israel for blast, accuses PLO of collusion.

April 9, 1995 - Seven Israelis killed in two separate suicide car bombings. Islamic Jihad claims responsibility for attack on bus carrying Israeli soldiers and settlers near Kfar Darom. Hamas says it carried out second attack on Israeli military convoy at nearby Netzarim.
July 24, 1995 - Hamas suicide bomber kills six people on bus in Tel Aviv suburb of Ramat Gan.
Aug 21, 1995 - Five people die in Hamas suicide bombing of bus in Jerusalem.

Jan 5, 1996 - Yahya Ayyash, known as "The Engineer" and believed the mastermind behind a wave of Islamic suicide bombings against Israel, is killed in the Gaza Strip when his cellular telephone blows up. Hamas vows to avenge his death.

Feb 25, 1996 - Suspected Islamic bombers kill 26 people in separate attacks in Jerusalem and the southern Israeli town of Ashkelon. Security sources said the bombings were in revenge for the killing of Ayyash.
March 3, 1996 - A bomb blast in a bus in Jerusalem kills at least 18 people and the suicide bomber.
March 4, 1996 - A suicide bomber kills at least 11 people and wounds 100 at a busy Tel Aviv shopping mall.

Sept 25, 1996 - Violence claiming lives of 61 Arabs and 15 Israeli soldiers erupts over Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's punching a second entrance into an archaeological tunnel site near Moslem shrines in Jerusalem.
March 21, 1997 - Bomb blast rips through outdoor cafe in Tel Aviv, killing three Israeli women along with the Palestinian attacker and wounding 42 people.
